Commentry: Starc to Imran Khan, out Caught by Wade!! Australia win by an innings and 5 runs. Hugs and handshakes all-round. There is a check for no-ball check and Starc is fine there. Khan was not going to hang around and as soon as he saw the full delivery, he went after it. The connection was not like the previous delivery, this one comes off the toe-end and skies up, Wade is stationed at deepish mid-on and he reverse cups it calmly. Imran Khan c Wade b Starc 5(6) [4s-1]

Starc to Imran Khan, FOUR, smashed! Khan enjoyed it as he has a big smile on his face as Shah walks up to him. Pakistan inch closer to making Australia bat again. Starc comes round the wicket and lands it full, Khan clears his front leg and pumps it straight back over the bowler
Hazlewood to Naseem Shah, no run, goes for the yorker but it is a full toss which Shah knocks to mid-on

Hazlewood to Naseem Shah, no run, tries to swing it off the Gabba but misses it by a mile. Shah clears his front leg and has a go, but the good length delivery flies over the stumps. The bounced helped him there

Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, out Caught by Pat Cummins!! Easy peasy! This was bound to happen with all the swings Afridi was having. Short of length delivery and he is beaten for pace, tries to pull but the ball comes off the splice of the bat, lobs towards mid-off where Cummins accepts the dolly. Australia are one wicket away from wrapping this up. Shaheen Afridi c Pat Cummins b Hazlewood 10(18) [4s-2]

Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, no run, slanted it full and outside off, Afridi sees the width and throws his bat, the thick inside edge bounces back to hit him on the body. So easily could have gone on to the stumps
Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, no run, bouncer angled across left hander, Afridi ducks and sways away from the line
Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, no run, on a length and around off, Afridi is solidly behind the line to defend
Starc to Imran Khan, no run, spears it full and outside off, Khan dangles his bat and is lucky not to have edged it

Starc to Imran Khan, no run, aims for the body and manages to get it on target, Khan turns his back and the ball lobs off the thigh pad to short leg. Stifled appeal for a bat-pad but it was nowhere close to the bat
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, 1 run, short of length delivery and this does not bounce much, Afridi pulls it along the ground to deep square leg
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, attempted yorker is sprayed down leg, Afridi does not get anything on the way
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, short of length at the body, Afridi is beaten for pace and the ball deflects off the thigh pad to Marnus at short leg
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, bouncer and Afridi is not hanging around, he opens up his body and has a go, but the bounce is just too good for him as the ball climbs over the top-edge
Hazlewood to Imran Khan, no run, short of a length and on Imran's body, he was taking evasive action and the ball runs down to long leg, off his body
Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, 1 run, banged in short and on Afridi's body, he plays with soft hands and nudges it to the right of the keeper
Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, no run, fuller length delivery and shaping away from the left-hander, hgas Afridi groping forward on the defensive push and beat him on the outside edge

Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, FOUR, top-edge and four, Afridi is having some fun now, short and angling across him, he went for a big pull, got a thick top-edge, high and over the slip cordon, one bounce and over the ropes
Hazlewood to Imran Khan, 1 run, fuller length delivery on Imran's pads, clipped behind square on the on-side for a single

Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, out Caught by Wade!! Hazlewood has another wicket to his name - Yasir's luck runs out, on a good length and angling into the right-hander, perhaps held onto the surface, Yasir was early into the tuck, closed the bat-face and the ball looped off the leading edge. Wade ran across to his right from cover, tumbled and completed a good two-handed catch. Yasir Shah c Wade b Hazlewood 42(55) [4s-6]

Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, much better from Starc, found his radar right on the last ball of the over, full and slanting across the left-hander, Afridi got his bat down in time and squeezes it towards the slip cordon
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, byes, FOUR, more runs for Pakistan, banged in short and it kept rising above the tall batsman - Paine had no chance as well, raced away to the ropes
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, Starc shortens his length and angles one onto Afridi's body, he was looking to work it to the on-side and is struck high on the thigh-pad
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, no run, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off, left alone

Starc to Shaheen Afridi, leg byes, FOUR, more runs for Pakistan, they now trail by 20 runs, full and sliding onto Afridi's pads, he was looking to tuck and missed, brushed the pads and rolled past the diving keeper
Starc to Shaheen Afridi, FOUR, a poor ball to start, full-toss on Afridi's pads and he gleefully whips it wide of mid-wicket for a boundary
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, on a good length and holding its line wide of off, Yasir 's feet went nowhere as he poked at that and missed
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, FOUR, that's a career-best for Yasir, short and at the stumps, he clears his left leg and hacks it wide of mid-wicket, no need to run for those

Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, 2 runs, top-edge and safe, banged in short and rising onto the right-hander, Yasir was in no position as he flapped, got a fat top-edge that has enough distance to evade Paind - who was running back in hope
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Yasir hops across slightly and gets a soft leading edge at the bowler
Hazlewood to Shaheen Afridi, byes, 1 run, banged in short and angling down leg, Afridi lets it go, the ball kept swirling away and Paine can only palm it down towards long leg

Hazlewood to Rizwan, out Caught by Lyon!! No maiden Test hundred for Rizwan, but he walks off to huge cheers across the Gabba. Hazlewood strikes and that should be it for Pakistan's hopes of taking this Test into the final day. This was short and wide of off, Rizwan saw the opportunity of getting a boundary, arched back slightly and flat-batted it behind point, there was a man at deep backward point, Lyon it was, and Rizwan managed to find him to perfection. Can Pakistan avoid an innings defeat now? Rizwan c Lyon b Hazlewood 95(145) [4s-10]
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, Cummins shortens his length on middle, nudged to the on-side
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Yasir leans across and pushes it to the on-side

Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, that's a ripper, huge leg-cutter from Cummins, hit a crack and bounced awkwardly at the gatsman, Yasir was half-forward on the defensive push and the ball whizzed past his shoulder. He looked started and Paine broke the stumps, but Yasir had managed to get his leg back into the crease by then
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, 1 run, fraction fuller and at the stumps, pushed to the left of mid-on for a single
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, 1 run, back of a length and on Yasir's pads, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, the bouncer from Cummins, Yasir ducks under it and lets it go
Lyon to Rizwan, 2 runs, dropped short and at the stumps, Rizwan makes room and cuts it square past cover for a couple of runs

Lyon to Rizwan, no run, that's a stunning catch from Labuschagne, he's claiming it, but Rizwan isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft signal is OUT. It's a fair delivery - he has caught it, but has the ball touched the ground while he completed it. Yes, it has, the third umpire has a look, NOT OUT is the call. Excellent effort from Labuschagne, but Rizwan survives - he wasn't in control over the catch and the ball did hit the grass - the lap sweep from Rizwan, went down low and got a top-edge onto his shoulder, the ball lobbed behind Paine's back - Labuschagne went across from FSL, Smith came across and dived from first slip - the ball stuck in the outstretched hands of Labuschagne, who thought it was a clean catch. Hang on - replays in and it went straight off Rizwan's shoulder - had this been caught, he could have reviewed and still survived
Lyon to Yasir Shah, 1 run, flatter and quicker from Lyon, Yasir goes back and nudges it backward of square on the on-side for a run
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, slower and around middle, Yasir leans across and turns it to the on-side
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, Lyon drifts one outside off, Yasir prods well forward and defends it to the off-side
Lyon to Rizwan, 1 run, flatter and at the stumps, punched down towards long-on for a single
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, very full and just outside off, Yasir squeezes it towards cover
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, 1 run, fraction fuller and at the stumps, driven in front of mid-on for a quick single
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Rizwan stays back and pushes it to the off-side

Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, 1 run, uppish and safe, on a good length and at the stumps, Yasir was a fraction too early on the clip, was in the air for a while but dropped well wide of the man at mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, no run, Cummins shortens his length outside off, Yasir plays away from his body and pushes it to the off-side
Pat Cummins to Yasir Shah, FOUR, beautifully played, length ball on the pads and Yasir picked it up early, exquisite timing as the ball flew behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, fraction short and quicker outside off, Rizwan watches it all along and lets it go
Lyon to Yasir Shah, 1 run, nicely tossed up outside off, Yasir reaches out and slices the drive behind square on the off-side for a single
Lyon to Rizwan, 1 run, fraction short and just outside off, pushed in front of cover for a single, gets to his nineties now
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, Rizwan comes down the tarck to a well flighted delivery and pushes it back at the bowler
Lyon to Rizwan, 2 runs, fraction short and well outside off, Rizwan makes room and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, comes back for the second
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, nicely bowled, the straighter one from Lyon, slower and wider of off, Rizwan was playing for the turn as he pressed forward, beaten on the outside edge
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 1 run, Labuschagne drops one short and well outside off, punched square on the off-side for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 2 runs, streaky, loopy leg-break and wide of off, Rizwan went chasing after that, gets a thick edge that went wide of the lonbe slip fielder
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 1 run, fraction too short from Labuschagne, punched off the back-foot and wide of cover-point for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 1 run, tossed up on off, punched down towards long-off for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, no run, pushed through quicker and wide of off, left alone
Labuschagne to Rizwan, no run, loopy delivery and well wide of off, Rizwan reaches out and finds cover with the drive
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, pushed through around middle, Yasir leans well forward on the block
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, turn and bounce for Lyon, but the ball was drifting down leg, Yasir was looking to nudge and got an inside edge onto the pads
Lyon to Yasir Shah, FOUR, Yasir is playing some fine shots now, slower and wider of off, Yasir bends down low and swipes it over mid-wicket, played with the turn and into the gap
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, nicely tossed up on off, Yasir leans half-forward and defends it to the off-side
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, fraction short and wide of off, pushed off the back-foot to backward point
Lyon to Yasir Shah, FOUR, lovely, Yasir runs down the track, gives himself room to free the arms and then lifts it nonchalantly over mid-on for a boundary

Labuschagne to Rizwan, FOUR, nicely played, poor ball from Labuschagne, too full and sliding down leg, Rizwan bent down low, rolled his wrists over the sweep and gets it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 1 run, slower and at the stumps, driven down to long-on for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 1 run, slower and on off, dropped in front of square on the off-side for a single
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 1 run, tossed up wider of off, driven to the left of cover for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 1 run, a juicy full-toss from Labuschagne, belted down to deep mid-wicket for a single
Labuschagne to Rizwan, no run, tossed up from round the wicket, Rizwan leans well forward and blocks
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, bit of extra bounce on the off-break, Shah hangs back and drops it near his feet. That will be tea on day 4
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, attacks off-stump with 90kph delivery and Shah negates it with a straight bat
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, slower and turning in, Shah blocks with a half-stride forward
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, tossed up outside off, Shah is early into the sweep shot and the toe-end drops dead on the surface
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, fraction short and Shah is on the back foot to defend it to Lyon
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, flighted around off, Shah drags the sweep straight to backward square
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 1 run, flatter and around off, Shah wrists it in front of mid-on and sets off, Labuschagne does the tidying
Labuschagne to Rizwan, 1 run, on the shorter side again and Rizwan chops it square of the wicket
Labuschagne to Rizwan, FOUR, another long hop and Rizwan accepts it gleefully. He is quick to rock back and pull it well in front of square, past Starc at mid-on and the ball races away to the fence
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 1 run, full toss outside off, Shah drives it to long-off
Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, 2 runs, once more on the shorter side and this time Shah mistimes the pull, just manages to clear mid-on and scampers back for the second

Labuschagne to Yasir Shah, FOUR, leg-spinner to leg-spinner, this is going to be interesting. Half tracker and Shah ain't letting it go, he treks back in the crease and pulls it to the vacant deep mid-wicket region
Lyon to Yasir Shah, 1 run, straighter one outside off, Shah angles it off the outer half towards backward point
Lyon to Rizwan, 1 run, slower and drifting in, Rizwan eases the drive along the ground to long-on
Lyon to Yasir Shah, 1 run, tossed up around off, Shah kneels down and sweeps it to deep square leg
Lyon to Yasir Shah, no run, flighted outside off, Shah taps it with an open bat face to point
Lyon to Rizwan, 1 run, dragged the length back on seeing Rizwan advance, the squirted inside edge evades the short leg fielder
Lyon to Rizwan, FOUR, fabulous shot! Driving against the spin never easy but Rizwan made it look damn easy. He dances down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it through extra cover
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, arrows in the yorker outside off, Shah bends down and jams it into the off-side
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, back of a length around off, Shah blocks it down the wicket
Hazlewood to Rizwan, 1 run, on a length close to off, Rizwan pats it square on the off-side and leaves Shah with two deliveries
Hazlewood to Rizwan, no run, angled in from wide of the crease, Rizwan wrists it to mid-on
Hazlewood to Rizwan, no run, fuller and around off, Rizwan is solidly forward to keep it out
Hazlewood to Rizwan, no run, short of length on off, Rizwan tries the one-legged pull but is cramped for room, chops it off the under-edge behind the stumps to the slip cordon

Starc to Yasir Shah, byes, FOUR, 147.6kph thunderbolt that is speared down leg and Shah had no chance of reaching that, Paine dives across and gets just a fingertip as the ball races away to the fence
Starc to Rizwan, 1 run, banged in halfway down, Rizwan rolls his wrists and pulls it along the ground to deep square leg

Starc to Rizwan, 2 runs, nicely played. Short of length delivery outside off, Rizwan hops up to ride the bounce and then punches it square on the off-side, he could not generate enough timing for the ball to reach the fence
Starc to Rizwan, no run, back of a length around off, Rizwan hops and defends it into the off-side
Starc to Yasir Shah, 1 run, drifting down leg, Shah flicks it past short leg and crosses over

Starc to Yasir Shah, no run, ouch! Angled in from round the wicket and Shah is late in bringing his bat across, the ball fizzes past the inside edge and strikes him on the thigh pad. No show of pain from the tough leggie
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, 1 run, short and at the body, Shah gloves the one-legged pull to backward square leg
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, on a length outside off, Shah walks into the forward defensive
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, pacy bouncer that is well-directed, Shah somehow manages to get himself under it
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, FOUR, fuller than a good length but Shah had the room to work with, he opens the bat face and slices the drive behind square on the off-side
Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, good length ball around off, Shah angles it towards backward point

Hazlewood to Yasir Shah, no run, loud shout for LBW. This time there was an inside edge. Hazlewood knew it as he didn't even discuss about the review. Nip-backer from a length and Shah is caught on the forward move, he was a dead duck if not for the little piece of wood

Starc to Yasir Shah, leg byes, 1 run, stifled appeal for LBW. But Starc and Paine knew it was going down. Shah is beaten for pace as he is late on the flick and the ball deflects off the pad into the on-side

Starc to Rizwan, 1 run, direct hit might have had Shah struggling. Rizwan pats it to cover and sets off, Wade swoops down from mid-off and fires a throw at the striker's end, Shah is not the swiftest and he was short with a direct hit
Starc to Rizwan, no run, bouncer from over the wicket and Rizwan ducks under to evade it
Starc to Yasir Shah, 1 run, sliding down leg and this time Shah makes contact to get off the mark with a single to fine leg
Starc to Yasir Shah, no run, short and at the body, Shah stands tall and fends it into the off-side

Starc to Yasir Shah, no run, angled in from round the wicket, keeps going on down leg, Shah does not meet with the glance. Starc twisted his ankle while landing and immediately grimmaced in pain. Pounds the landing area and is fine to continue..

Pat Cummins to Rizwan, FOUR, cracking shot! Just a wee bit of width on offer and Rizwan unleashes a fierce cut shot behind point, Lyon had been brought in to stop the single and he had no chance of stopping or chasing that
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, fuller and outside off, Rizwan drives on the rise and has Marnus sprawling at cover to make the stop
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, back of a length around off, Rizwan hops and defends it down the wicket
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, and again.. Three in a row from Cummins and Rizwan gets down quickly to elude it
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, bouncer around leg-stump, Rizwan is taking the safer option of letting it go
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, continues with the short stuff from round the wicket.. Rizwan ducks to evade

Lyon to Babar Azam, out Caught by Paine!! There's the wicket. GOAT does it for Australia. He has broken this 132-run partnership and has given his side an opening. Azam walks off to a standing ovation. Flatter and sliding on outside off, Azam goes back to force it through the off-side but only manages a faint outside edge to Paine. He was defeated for pace as the bat was late to come down. Sharp take by the Australian skipper as well as the ball was coming at a quicker pace. Babar Azam c Paine b Lyon 104(173) [4s-13]
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, slower and slightly drags the length back, Azam adjusts his forward prods to defend it back
Lyon to Rizwan, 1 run, flighted and the length is perfect to work a single down to long-on
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, tossed up outside off, Rizwan moves forward and across to block it into the on-side
Lyon to Babar Azam, 1 run, lands it fuller outside off and a gentle push wide of mid-off allows Azam to cross over
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, comes down the track and wrists it to the right of Lyon, who is quick to move across and stop the single
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, lifter around leg-stump, Rizwan ducks and allows it to sail over him

Pat Cummins to Rizwan, 2 runs, "catch" went someone but it was well placed. Short and at the body, Rizwan decides to take it on and pulls it uppishly backward of square leg, Starc runs across from fine leg and parries it to his mate coming around from deep square
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, the bumper barrage continues, this is around leg-stump line, Rizwan bends down and evades it
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, short of length around off, Rizwan rises on his toes and drops it into the off-side
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, bumper at 136kph, it was too short and gave Rizwan ample time to duck underneath
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 run, short and at the hips, tucked away to backward square leg
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, oh! Turn and bounce for Lyon. Rizwan moves back in the crease to play the cut but the extra lift defeats him completely, he is lucky not to have got an edge on that
Lyon to Babar Azam, 1 run, comes down the track and works it with the spin down to long-on
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, slower and outside off, Azam plunges forward and blocks it back
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, slider and outside off, Azam presses across and defends into the off-side
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, flighted and turning in, Azam pushes it off the inner half to Lyon
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, very full and outside off, Azam squeezes the drive to cover
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, banged in halfway down and Rizwan arches back, he was almost letting it go before having a swish, the ball keeps climbing and whizzes past the top-edge

Pat Cummins to Rizwan, 2 runs, dangles the full delivery outside off and Rizwan goes chasing after it, since he had to reach out the drive was not under control, struck it uppishly through the vacant cover region
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, short of length close to off, Rizwan rides the bounce by hopping and tapping it to point
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, fuller and around off, Rizwan is compact in his forward block to cover
Pat Cummins to Rizwan, no run, pacy bouncer angled in, Rizwan sits down on his knees and allows it to sail over him
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 run, drifting on the pads and Azam flicks it to deep backward square, just a single
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, flatter delivery outside off, Rizwan moves across and dabs it in front of backward point
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, makes room and cuts it straight to the cover fielder
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, slower and drawing the batsman forward, defended
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, fraction short and Rizwan chops the cut into the off-side
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, tossed up around off, blocked back down the wicket

Lyon to Rizwan, FOUR, maiden Test fifty for Rizwan. He got out in a controversial manner in the first innings but he wasn't to be denied this time around. The 'keeper has made a strong return to Test cricket. Takes on the flighted delivery and sweeps it backward of square leg, more of a top-edge but he ensured it landed safely and raced away to the fence

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, that was close, only the inside edge saved Babar there, full and jagging back in viciously, Babar was caught off-guard by the amount of nip, played right across the line and only the inside edge saved him, else he was caught bang in front of middle
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Babar leant forward on the drive and gets an inside edge to mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, FOUR, hundred for Babar, his second in Tests, a delighted punch in the air, removes his helmet and soaks in the appreciation from the crowd, then its time for the sajda - coming to the ball, on a good length and well outside off, he leant into the drive, played on the up and found the gap wide of extra-cover
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, much better bouncer from Cummins, kept following Babar with the angle, he does well to drop his gloves and sways away from the line
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, another bouncer from Cummins, Babar ducks under it and lets it go

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, FOUR, cracking shot, Babar moves onto 96 with an emphatic pull, rolled his wrists over the short ball and pulled it in front of square on the on-side, beat mid-wicket and raced away to the ropes
Starc to Rizwan, no run, nicely bowled, banged in short and kept rising onto the right-hander, Rizwan rode with the bounce, played with soft hands and kept it down
Starc to Rizwan, no run, the bouncer from Starc, Rizwan ducks under it and lets it go
Starc to Rizwan, no run, short and wide of off, Rizwan looks to slash it over the slip cordon and is beaten on the top-edge
Starc to Rizwan, no run, banged in short and rearing onto the right-hander, Rizwan looked awkward as he rode the bounce, but did well to drop it down
Starc to Rizwan, FOUR, lovely, short and wide of off, Rizwan gets on top of the bounce and cuts it up and over backward point, almost went all the way, bounced just inside the ropes
Starc to Rizwan, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Rizwan presses across and turns it to the on-side
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, flighted delivery on the leg-stump line, defended with a straight bat
Lyon to Babar Azam, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too short from Lyon, Babar makes room and punches it with a straight bat, wide of cover and he moves into the nineties now
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, Babar shimmies dowm the track to a well flighted delivery and defends it off the pads
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, fraction short and drifting onto Babar's pads, clipped straight to the fielder at short fine
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, tossed up around the middle-stump line, defended to the on-side
Lyon to Babar Azam, no run, tossed up around middle, Babar gets his bat in front of the pad and then defends
Starc to Rizwan, no run, back of a length and at the stumps, defended back at the bowler
Starc to Rizwan, no run, much better from Starc, shortened his length and got it to shape away from the right-hander, had Rizwan feeling for it and beat him on the outside edge
Starc to Babar Azam, 3 runs, back of a length and well wide of off, Babar stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats the diving cover fielder and comes back for the third

Starc to Rizwan, 3 runs, beautifully played, full and sliding into Rizwan's pads, he gets inside the line and clips it wide of mid-on - a long chase for Hazlewood and they come back for the third, brings up the 100-run stand
Starc to Rizwan, no run, the bouncer from Starc, but it's way too short and well outside off, left alone
Starc to Babar Azam, 1 run, short of a length and lifting onto the right-hander, Babar couldn't ride the bounce as he pushed forward, inside edge behind square on the on-side for a single
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, tossed up well wide of off, Rizwan presses across and then blocks
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, much better from Lyon, loopy delivery outside off, Rizwan lunges forward on the defensive block
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, tossed up well outside off, Rizwan leans across and defends it to the off-side
Lyon to Rizwan, FOUR, lovely, fraction too short from Lyon, Rizwan is quick to rock back and cuts it in front of square on the off-side for a boundary
Lyon to Rizwan, no run, tossed up outside off, Rizwan shimmies down the track and flicks it to mid-wicket
Lyon to Babar Azam, 1 run, Babar shimmies down the tarck to a well flighted delivery and drives it to long-on for a single
Starc to Rizwan, no run, a loose shot from Rizwan, was looking to pull a short ball and was clearly beaten for pace, way too late and is lucky he didn't get an edge on that
Starc to Rizwan, no run, the bouncer from Starc, but it's way too short and flies over the head of Rizwan
Starc to Rizwan, no run, Starc shortens his length around off, Rizwan hops across and keeps it down
Starc to Rizwan, no run, short and wide of off, Rizwan standas tall and cuts it to the left of backward point - was in the air for a long time, but bounced well in front of Lyon

Lyon to Masood, 3 runs, half-chance and Burns can't hold on - positive intent from Masood, came running down the track, made room and drilled the drive to the left of mid-off - Burns covered some distance, threw himself at the ball, got both hands but the ball didn't stick
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, Cummins shortens his length outside off, Babar stays besides the line and pushes it to the off-side
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, on a good length and holding its line wide of off, left alone

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, that jagged back in sharply, pitched around off and came back with the angle, Babar was caught in the crease as he pushed from the crease, beaten on the inside edge and struck him high on the pads

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, blocked back to the bowler and that is that for the day

Lyon to Masood, no run. Telly umpire's checking for a fair catch. Soft signal is not out. No issues with the front foot and guess its bump ball. Smith caught it at first slip and it seemed to have gone on the bounce. Michael Gough is considering different angles to make a decision and he's satisfied with what he saw. The onfield verdict - not out - remains. Masood was on the front foot trying to block a full offbreak and he got the thinnest of outside edges that dropped just short of Smith at second slip. umpire Richard Kettleborough took his time before sending upstairs and he was completely sure it came off the bat

Lyon to Masood, no run, massive turn off the deck and there's extra bounce too which got the close-in fielders excited. Masood was leaning across and had no clue where the ball went. Lots of oohs and aahs ring around the Gabba
Lyon to Masood, no run, slows it up and gets it to spin away outside off, Masood strides across to block it in front of silly point
Lyon to Masood, FOUR, short and wide, Masood pounces with disdain! Rocks back and slaps the cut through point with terrific timing
Hazlewood to Masood, 1 run, angling in on the pads at 129ks, worked round the corner for an easy single
Hazlewood to Masood, no run, back of a length on and around off-stump, blunted off the back foot

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, 3 runs, too full and in the slot outside off for Babar, he nails the cover-drive uppishly and gets it in the gap between extra cover and point

Hazlewood to Masood, 1 run, fullish on the pads, flicked away to the left of square leg
Starc to Babar Azam, 2 runs, gets inside the line of a length delivery and clips it down to fine leg

Starc to Babar Azam, 1 run, 137ks short of length delivery on middle and leg, tucked into the mid-wicket pocket and they sneak a quick single

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, 3 runs, touch full and Babar opens the bat face on the drive wide of cover, hasn't got the timing right but the best part about this shot is that he didn't try to overhit and purely relied on middling the ball
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, fuller and wider, Babar Azam resists all his temptations and lets it go
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, good length around off-stump, back to the blocking dance is Babar Azam

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, FOUR, off the mark and there's quality written all over that shot. Pat Cummins over compensates and bowls it a tad full outside off, Babar slides into his driving posture and effortlessly crunches it off the middle of the bat wide of mid-off

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, leg byes, 2 runs, length delivery at 141ks on the pads, Babar misses the glance but doesn't miss out on stealing the second as the ball flies off the pads to the right of fine leg
Pat Cummins to Masood, 1 run, attempts a loose drive outside off and gets a thick inside edge rolling down to the left of fine leg. Streaky!
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, 133ks good length delivery around off, blunted into the off-side

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, can't escape this! A peach of a nip-backer from Hazlewood and Babar Azam had to play at it, wobbles in from outside off and beats Babar on the inside edge before flying past his off-stump
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, and again! Babar Azam looks very determined not to make a mistake and he's going to do that for a long, long time if Pakistan are to take the game deep
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, a real teaser outside off, full and wide at 138ks, Babar Azam stays put and lets it pass

Hazlewood to Masood, no run, edged and drops short of Labuschagne at third slip. Sharp inswinger and Masood plays with a closed bat face that induces a thick outside edge, flies and just dies in front of the diving slip fielder
Hazlewood to Masood, no run, skiddy length delivery on the pads at 135ks, Masood's late on the tuck and wears it on the thigh pad

Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, well wide of off, Babar lifts his bat and lets it go
Pat Cummins to Babar Azam, no run, good length on off-stump, Babar blocks it under his eyes

Pat Cummins to Shafiq, out Caught by Smith!! Three down. Pakistan falling apart.... Yet again it's that splice-jarring length from Pat Cummins and he turns Shafiq into an 'S' whilst hanging his bat out with hard hands, a thick edge and it flies to Steve Smith at second slip who pouches it with zero fuss. Extra bounce was the key and although Shafiq played it late, the skid of the deck ensured it flew into the bucket hands of second slip. Shafiq c Smith b Pat Cummins 0(6)
Pat Cummins to Shafiq, no run, full and tailing in late off the seam outside off, Shafiq bends his back knee looking to drive it through the covers. Beaten on the inside edge

Starc to Shafiq, no run, back of a length outside off, crunched but straight to backward point

Starc to Shafiq, no run, short and too far down the leg-side, Shafiq ducks without having much of a sight at the delivery. Time Paine dives full length to his left and collects it one-handed to cause a roar of applause from the sparse Gabba crowd

Starc to Haris Sohail, out Caught by Paine!! Haris Sohail shuts his eyes in disbelief and takes a moment or two before trudging back to the pavilion. He has just carbon-copied his first innings dismissal against the same bowler and Pakistan are two down inside five overs. Short and nipping away ever so slightly outside off, the line's too far outside off and Haris Sohail didn't need to play at that. He decides otherwise and plays a lame poke, only to send the easiest of catches to Tim Paine behind the stumps. Haris Sohail c Paine b Starc 8(8) [4s-1]

Starc to Haris Sohail, FOUR, nice and steady is Haris Sohail and the pace of Mitch Starc takes care of the rest. Opens his bat face at the last instant and allows the bat to kiss the ball, minimal effort and the placement - not sure if he's intended - did the job for Haris Sohail
Starc to Masood, 1 run, full and zoning in towards middle and leg, flicked wide of mid-wicket for a quick single
Starc to Masood, 2 runs, 141ks short ball down the leg-side, Masood swivels and pulls to the right of fine leg where Cummins dives to prevent the boundary
Pat Cummins to Haris Sohail, no run, 134ks bouncer sprayed down leg, Haris Sohail sits under it
Pat Cummins to Haris Sohail, no run, stays on the back foot and blocks the length delivery with a straight bat
Pat Cummins to Haris Sohail, no run, full outside off, driven into the covers once again

Pat Cummins to Masood, 1 run, short of length jopo at 131ks, Masood opens the bat face and steers it square on the off-side

Pat Cummins to Haris Sohail, 3 runs, yet again plays with an open bat face and sends the full delivery racing behind point, Lyon gives chase and flicks the ball back with a slide inches inside the boundary ropes. Terrific commitment from the offspinner
Starc to Haris Sohail, 1 run, opens the bat face to a full delivery and pushes the drive wide of cover

Starc to Azhar Ali, out Lbw!! Azhar Ali has been given out lbw. He reviews just in time (one second left literally). Fair delivery, no inside edge and it's umpire's call on hitting. Review retained but the Pakistan skipper will have to walk back to the dressing room. A sharp in-angler from a good length and Azhar Ali was found guilty of moving too far across, pretty much missed a straight delivery and got pinned in line with middle and leg. Instant verdict from umpire Richard Kettleborough and Azhar Ali thought long and hard before going upstairs. The skid and pace of Starc may have hurried the Pakistan skipper who got beaten on the inside edge, only to be adjudged lbw moments later. Azhar Ali lbw b Starc 5(9) [4s-1]

Starc to Azhar Ali, FOUR. Pace - yes. Width - yes. Full - yes. Azhar Ali gets the perfect recipe for a drive and he latches on with a gorgeous full-blooded front foot stroke off the middle of the bat, through covers and no-one's chasing that
Starc to Azhar Ali, no run, another left alone outside Azhar Ali's off-stump
Starc to Azhar Ali, no run, 142ks swinging away from a length, Azhar Ali plants his front foot across and hoists his bat over his head
Starc to Azhar Ali, no run, bumper down the leg-side at 142ks, Azhar Ali ducks under it
Pat Cummins to Masood, no run, full and slanting away at 139ks, nothing doing from Masood
Pat Cummins to Masood, no run, full and nipping away at 137ks, Masood covers his off-stump and shoulders arms

Pat Cummins to Azhar Ali, 1 run, short of length just outside off, Azhar Ali gets squared up a fraction and leaves his bat hanging in the process. Snicks it off the thick inside half and gets it rolling past the fielder at backward point
Pat Cummins to Azhar Ali, no run, full and swinging down the leg-side, Azhar Ali gets across but fails to lay bat on the flick/glance
Pat Cummins to Azhar Ali, no run, short of length angling in at 136ks, blocked to the left of FSL

Starc to Masood, FOUR, ups his pace does Mitchell Starc and Masood takes complete toll of it. Gets inside the line of a full delivery and helps it on its way to the deep square fence

Starc to Masood, no run, the taste gets better now, fiery bumper outside off and Masood's not getting anywhere close. Arches his back and stays away from the line of fire

Starc to Masood, no run, that has just woken Shan Masood up from his slumber, Starc doesn't care. Just has a wry smile and trudges back to his bowling mark. A pacy back of a length delivery at the body and Masood was late to react on the tuck/flick, gets beaten on the outside edge and takes a smashing blow around his hip. Grimaces in pain immediately and walks into the leg-side to compose himself. Ouch!
